verses.kjv: The word of the LORD which came to Jeremiah the prophet against the Gentiles;
verses.web: LORD’s word which came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the nations.
verses.ct: This is the word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the nations.

verses.kjv: Against Egypt, against the army of Pharaohnecho king of Egypt, which was by the river Euphrates in Carchemish, which Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon smote in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah.
verses.web: Of Egypt: concerning the army of Pharaoh Necoh king of Egypt, which was by the river Euphrates in Carchemish, which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon struck in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah.
verses.ct: Regarding Egypt — specifically the army of Pharaohnecho king of Egypt, which was stationed at Carchemish on the Euphrates River. Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon defeated this army in the 4th year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah, king of Judah.

verses.kjv: Order ye the buckler and shield, and draw near to battle.
verses.web: “Prepare the buckler and shield, and draw near to battle!
verses.ct: "Grab your shields and bucklers! Line up for battle!

verses.kjv: Harness the horses; and get up, ye horsemen, and stand forth with your helmets; furbish the spears, and put on the brigandines.
verses.web: Harness the horses, and get up, you horsemen, and stand up with your helmets. Polish the spears, put on the coats of mail.
verses.ct: Harness the horses! Mount up, horsemen! Take your positions with helmets on! Sharpen your spears and strap on your armor!"

verses.kjv: Wherefore have I seen them dismayed and turned away back? and their mighty ones are beaten down, and are fled apace, and look not back: for fear was round about, saith the LORD.
verses.web: Why have I seen it? They are dismayed and are turned backward. Their mighty ones are beaten down, have fled in haste, and don’t look back. Terror is on every side,” says LORD.
verses.ct: "But what do I see? They're panicking and falling back! Their strongest warriors are crushed, running for their lives without even a backward glance — because terror surrounds them on every side," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Let not the swift flee away, nor the mighty man escape; they shall stumble, and fall toward the north by the river Euphrates.
verses.web: “Don’t let the swift flee away, nor the mighty man escape. In the north by the river Euphrates they have stumbled and fallen.
verses.ct: "The fastest runners can't escape, and the mightiest soldiers can't break free. There in the north, along the Euphrates River, they stumble and fall.

verses.kjv: Who is this that cometh up as a flood, whose waters are moved as the rivers?
verses.web: “Who is this who rises up like the Nile, whose waters toss themselves like the rivers?
verses.ct: "Who is this, rising like the Nile in flood, its waters churning like a raging river?

verses.kjv: Egypt riseth up like a flood, and his waters are moved like the rivers; and he saith, I will go up, and will cover the earth; I will destroy the city and the inhabitants thereof.
verses.web: Egypt rises up like the Nile, and his waters toss themselves like the rivers. He says, ‘I will rise up. I will cover the earth. I will destroy cities and its inhabitants.’
verses.ct: Egypt rises like the Nile in flood, its waters surging and churning. Egypt boasts, 'I will rise up and cover the earth! I will destroy cities and everyone in them!'

verses.kjv: Come up, ye horses; and rage, ye chariots; and let the mighty men come forth; the Ethiopians and the Libyans, that handle the shield; and the Lydians, that handle and bend the bow.
verses.web: Go up, you horses! Rage, you chariots! Let the mighty men go out: Cush and Put, who handle the shield; and the Ludim, who handle and bend the bow.
verses.ct: Charge, horses! Drive furiously, chariots! Let the warriors march out — soldiers from Cush and Put carrying their shields, and archers from Lud drawing their bows.

verses.kjv: For this is the day of the Lord GOD of hosts, a day of vengeance, that he may avenge him of his adversaries: and the sword shall devour, and it shall be satiate and made drunk with their blood: for the Lord GOD of hosts hath a sacrifice in the north country by the river Euphrates.
verses.web: For that day is of the Lord, LORD of Armies, a day of vengeance, that he may avenge himself of his adversaries. The sword will devour and be satiated, and will drink its fill of their blood; for the Lord, LORD of Armies, has a sacrifice in the north country by the river Euphrates.
verses.ct: But this day belongs to the Lord GOD of hosts — a day of vengeance when he pays back his enemies. The sword will devour until it's full, drunk on their blood. The Lord GOD of hosts is making a sacrifice in the north country, along the Euphrates River.

verses.kjv: Go up into Gilead, and take balm, O virgin, the daughter of Egypt: in vain shalt thou use many medicines; for thou shalt not be cured.
verses.web: Go up into Gilead, and take balm, virgin daughter of Egypt. You use many medicines in vain. There is no healing for you.
verses.ct: Go to Gilead and find balm for your wounds, virgin daughter of Egypt! You can try every medicine you want, but nothing will heal you.

verses.kjv: The nations have heard of thy shame, and thy cry hath filled the land: for the mighty man hath stumbled against the mighty, and they are fallen both together.
verses.web: The nations have heard of your shame, and the earth is full of your cry; for the mighty man has stumbled against the mighty, they both fall together.”
verses.ct: The nations have heard about your disgrace, and your cries of defeat fill the land. Warrior trips over warrior, and they collapse together."

verses.kjv: The word that the LORD spake to Jeremiah the prophet, how Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon should come and smite the land of Egypt.
verses.web: The word that LORD spoke to Jeremiah the prophet, how that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon should come and strike the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: This is the word the LORD spoke to Jeremiah the prophet about how Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon would come and attack the land of Egypt.

verses.kjv: Declare ye in Egypt, and publish in Migdol, and publish in Noph and in Tahpanhes: say ye, Stand fast, and prepare thee; for the sword shall devour round about thee.
verses.web: “Declare in Egypt, publish in Migdol, and publish in Memphis and in Tahpanhes: say, ‘Stand up, and prepare; for the sword has devoured around you.’
verses.ct: "Announce it in Egypt! Proclaim it in Migdol! Shout it in Noph and Tahpanhes! Say, 'Take your positions and get ready, because the sword is already devouring everything around you.'

verses.kjv: Why are thy valiant men swept away? they stood not, because the LORD did drive them.
verses.web: Why are your strong ones swept away? They didn’t stand, because LORD pushed them.
verses.ct: Why have your mighty warriors been swept away? They couldn't hold their ground because the LORD himself drove them back.

verses.kjv: He made many to fall, yea, one fell upon another: and they said, Arise, and let us go again to our own people, and to the land of our nativity, from the oppressing sword.
verses.web: He made many to stumble. Yes, they fell on one another. They said, ‘Arise! Let’s go again to our own people, and to the land of our birth, from the oppressing sword.’
verses.ct: He made soldier after soldier stumble, and they fell over each other. Then they said, 'Get up! Let's go back to our own people, back to the land where we were born — away from this deadly sword!'

verses.kjv: They did cry there, Pharaoh king of Egypt is but a noise; he hath passed the time appointed.
verses.web: They cried there, ‘Pharaoh king of Egypt is but a noise; he has let the appointed time pass by.’
verses.ct: When they got there, they cried out, 'Pharaoh king of Egypt is nothing but loud talk! He let his moment slip away.'"

verses.kjv: As I live, saith the King, whose name is the LORD of hosts, Surely as Tabor is among the mountains, and as Carmel by the sea, so shall he come.
verses.web: “As I live,” says the King, whose name is LORD of Armies, “surely like Tabor among the mountains, and like Carmel by the sea, so he will come.
verses.ct: "As surely as I live," declares the King, whose name is the LORD of hosts, "one is coming who towers over others like Tabor among the mountains, like Carmel rising above the sea.

verses.kjv: O thou daughter dwelling in Egypt, furnish thyself to go into captivity: for Noph shall be waste and desolate without an inhabitant.
verses.web: You daughter who dwells in Egypt, furnish yourself to go into captivity; for Memphis will become a desolation, and will be burned up, without inhabitant.
verses.ct: Pack your bags for exile, daughter living in Egypt! Noph will be left in ruins — burned and empty, without a single person living there.

verses.kjv: Egypt is like a very fair heifer, but destruction cometh; it cometh out of the north.
verses.web: “Egypt is a very beautiful heifer; but destruction out of the north has come. It has come.
verses.ct: "Egypt is a beautiful young cow, but a horsefly from the north is coming for her. It's already on its way.

verses.kjv: Also her hired men are in the midst of her like fatted bullocks; for they also are turned back, and are fled away together: they did not stand, because the day of their calamity was come upon them, and the time of their visitation.
verses.web: Also her hired men in the middle of her are like calves of the stall; for they also are turned back. They have fled away together. They didn’t stand, for the day of their calamity has come on them, the time of their visitation.
verses.ct: Even her hired soldiers living among her are like fattened calves — pampered and useless. They too have turned and run away together. They couldn't stand their ground, because the day of their disaster has arrived, the time of their punishment.

verses.kjv: The voice thereof shall go like a serpent; for they shall march with an army, and come against her with axes, as hewers of wood.
verses.web: Its sound will go like the serpent; for they will march with an army, and come against her with axes, as wood cutters.
verses.ct: Egypt will hiss like a retreating snake as the enemy marches in with full force. They'll come at her with axes, like men chopping down trees.

verses.kjv: They shall cut down her forest, saith the LORD, though it cannot be searched; because they are more than the grasshoppers, and are innumerable.
verses.web: They will cut down her forest,” says LORD, “though it can’t be searched; because they are more than the locusts, and are innumerable.
verses.ct: They will cut down her forest," says the LORD, "even though it seems too thick to penetrate — because the invaders outnumber locusts. There's no counting them.

verses.kjv: The daughter of Egypt shall be confounded; she shall be delivered into the hand of the people of the north.
verses.web: The daughter of Egypt will be disappointed; she will be delivered into the hand of the people of the north.”
verses.ct: The daughter of Egypt will be humiliated, handed over to the people from the north."

verses.kjv: The LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, saith; Behold, I will punish the multitude of No, and Pharaoh, and Egypt, with their gods, and their kings; even Pharaoh, and all them that trust in him:
verses.web: LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says: “Behold, I will punish Amon of No, and Pharaoh, and Egypt, with her gods, and her kings; even Pharaoh, and those who trust in him.
verses.ct: The LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: "Watch — I am about to punish Amon of No, Pharaoh, Egypt, her gods, and her kings. Yes, Pharaoh and everyone who puts their trust in him.

verses.kjv: And I will deliver them into the hand of those that seek their lives, and into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, and into the hand of his servants: and afterward it shall be inhabited, as in the days of old, saith the LORD.
verses.web: I will deliver them into the hand of those who seek their lives, and into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and into the hand of his servants. Afterwards it will be inhabited, as in the days of old,” says LORD.
verses.ct: I will hand them over to those who want them dead — to Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon and his officers. But afterward, Egypt will be lived in again, just as it was in ancient times," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: But fear not thou, O my servant Jacob, and be not dismayed, O Israel: for, behold, I will save thee from afar off, and thy seed from the land of their captivity; and Jacob shall return, and be in rest and at ease, and none shall make him afraid.
verses.web: “But don’t you be afraid, Jacob my servant. Don’t be dismayed, Israel; for, behold, I will save you from afar, and your offspring from the land of their captivity. Jacob will return, and will be quiet and at ease. No one will make him afraid.
verses.ct: "But don't be afraid, Jacob my servant. Don't lose heart, Israel. I am going to rescue you from far away and bring your descendants back from the land where they're held captive. Jacob will return home and live in peace and comfort, and no one will threaten him again.

verses.kjv: Fear thou not, O Jacob my servant, saith the LORD: for I am with thee; for I will make a full end of all the nations whither I have driven thee: but I will not make a full end of thee, but correct thee in measure; yet will I not leave thee wholly unpunished.
verses.web: Don’t be afraid, O Jacob my servant,” says LORD; “for I am with you; for I will make a full end of all the nations where I have driven you; but I will not make a full end of you, but I will correct you in measure, and will in no way leave you unpunished.”
verses.ct: Don't be afraid, Jacob my servant," says the LORD, "because I am with you. I will completely destroy every nation where I've scattered you, but I won't completely destroy you. I will discipline you — but fairly. Still, I won't let you go entirely unpunished."
